Articles.Content: When I load up KSP, and go to the VAB or SPH, I can place a first part, but when I Shift+Click to paste a section, I can not add it. Then, the center of lift indicator pops up. If I place any parts, they will not go, and orient themselves at odd angles and do not place. If I try to leave, the button looks as if it has been clicked, but I go into a weird mode where I can mouse over things, but not click them or scroll the screen. Is something corrupted?
If you are trying to copy a part it's ALT+Click, I have no idea what SHIFT+Click does (If anything) also, pictures of the problem would really help here.

What operating system? I'm running Windows.

When I go to the VAB/SPH and shift-click on the parts list, nothing unusual happens. When you Shift-Click on the craft, it selects the whole thing. In either case, you should never have to Shift-Click to pickup or place parts. And like Taki said, you use ALT-Click to copy an existing part (but not to place it).

So I suppose that leads me to the question, are you using any mods? I think some of the editor extensions add hotkeys which toggle various symmetry and angle snap modes.

If you are trying to copy a part it's ALT+Click, I have no idea what SHIFT+Click does (If anything) also, pictures of the problem would really help here.

Shift+click selects the entire craft. Very handy if you can't see your pod, or don't want to scroll up to it.
